relation: Specify how the attribute is accessible: Public Protected–only visible within its own package and subclasses. Private–not visible for subclasses Default–only visible within its own package
Specify whether the attribute is Final, Static, Transient, or Volatile. Note: Selecting some modifiers may disable others.

Select a potential relationship and click the 1:1 Mapping or 1:M Mapping button, located between the Potential Relationships and Selected Relationships windows., 117387=Select an entry from Potential Relationships and click the 1:1 Mapping or 1:M Mapping button, located between the Potential Relationships and Selected Relationships windows. See Chapter 27, "Introduction to Relational Mappings" for more information on mappings., 243850=loginspec (see Section 5.8.10, "How to Create the loginspec Task");}
textBeforeTable: Use the following information to enter data in the Modifiers fields on the Attributes tab: Description of "Figure 5-41 Attributes Tab, Modifiers Fields" Figure 5-41 Attributes Tab, Modifiers Fields Click the General tab. Click the Attributes tab. The Attributes tab contains two sub-tabs. Click the Class Info tab in the Editor. Select a class in the Navigator. Its properties appear in the Editor. To specify access modifiers, use this procedure: 5.7.2.5.1 Using TopLink Workbench This section includes information on Using TopLink Workbench to configure attribute modifiers. 5.7.2.5 Configuring Attribute Modifiers Accessors General The Attributes tab contains the following tabs: To rename an existing attribute, select the attribute and click Rename. To delete an existing attribute, select the attribute and click Remove. To add a new attribute (field) to the descriptor, click Add. 5.7.2.4.1 Using TopLink Workbench This section includes information on Using TopLink Workbench
textAfterTable: 5.7.2.6 Configuring Attribute Type Declaration This section includes information on Using TopLink Workbench to configure attribute type declaration. 5.7.2.6.1 Using TopLink Workbench To specify attribute type declaration, use this procedure: Select a class in the Navigator. Its properties appear in the Editor. Click the Class Info tab in the Editor. Click the Attributes tab. The Attributes tab contains two sub-tabs. Click the General tab. Figure 5-42 Attributes Tab, Type Declaration Fields Description of "Figure 5-42 Attributes Tab, Type Declaration Fields" Use the following information to enter data in Type Declaration fields on the Attributes tab: Field Description Type Click Browse and select a class and package for the attribute. Dimensionality
